meanings.definition: A person who criticizes or speaks ill of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The detractor always finds something negative to say about others.
meanings.sent2: She ignored the detractor's hurtful comments and focused on the positive.
meanings.sent3: The detractor's constant complaints became like background noise.
meanings.sent4: His words were like arrows from a detractor's bow, aiming to bring others down.
meanings.sent5: The detractor's words were like dark clouds overshadowing the sunny day.

meanings.definition: To take away a part from; diminish.
meanings.sent1: The storm will detract from the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent2: Please don't let one mistake detract from all your hard work.
meanings.sent3: Adding too many toppings might detract from the flavor of the pizza.
meanings.sent4: Her absence seemed to detract from the joy of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise detracted from the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
